subject: Entrepreneurship
title: Workaholism: When Hustle Becomes a Prison
description: A short lesson to help you apply Workaholism: When Hustle Becomes a Prison.

hook.text: Elon Musk slept on Tesla's factory floor. He called it 'production hell.' The media called it dedication.

buildup.text: Workaholism isn't hard workâ€”it's the compulsive inability to stop, even when it damages everything else.

discovery.text: Psychologists classify it as a behavioral addiction. Like gambling, the high comes from the activity itself.

twist.text: Startup culture disguises workaholism as virtue. Grinding is celebrated; setting boundaries is seen as weak.

climax.text: Research from Bergen University shows workaholics produce worse outcomesâ€”more errors, broken relationships.

punchline.text: Working hard is a choice. Not stopping isn't.

quiz.question: How do psychologists classify workaholism?
options: As a behavioral addiction similar to gambling
As a positive personality trait linked to success
As a temporary phase that resolves naturally
